ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a greater understanding of aspects of German history of which I had little previous knowledge, such as colonialism and the formation of early Germany. Our class had fruitful discussions about many different topics and I felt challenged during every course meeting.
Since the majority of the course invoiced watching Babylon Berlin I improved my listening skills. Ie better understand German as its being spoken among native speakers
Grammar, speaking tasks, interacting with German media
I learned a ton of German history and learned more high-level vocabulary and how to write better essays.
The course developed high-level German skills, as well as an ability to analyze German history with precision and nuance

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths:
- The course challenged me in several aspects of language learning: speaking, grammar, writing, and reading comprehension. Professor Gehlker did a wonderful job of providing different assignments for these areas.
- I had freedom in choosing topics for assignments and researching what I was truly interested in.

Weaknesses:
- Sometimes, there was too much content to watch or read prior to classes. Sometimes watching movies or videos can be done while doing other tasks, but doing so in another language requires a lot of focus. Sometimes we had to watch 2+ hours of a movie per course.
Would have appreciated more grammar. Barely did any grammar.
Strengths - interesting content, Babylon Berlin (TV show) was well-done, organized work and assignments

strengths: lots of diverse readings, films, sources, and topics, Babylon Berlin was awesome!

weaknesses: sometimes a lot of busy work assignments that are more fitting for a lower level course
This course is interactive and the topics are relevant.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend it to students who are already interested in history. It is not a class for someone who just wants to take an L5 course for fulfilling a degreerequirement.
I would definitely recommend this class. It was fun and I learned so much about German history in an interactive and exciting way that didn't involve reading a bunch of historical texts.
I would, if they are looking to know more about this interesting time in German history and to improve their German along the way
I would recommend this to someone who wants to learn about German culture and history between the two World Wars.
Yes, I thought the class was well taught and presenting in a very engaging fashion.
